page.title: 18Colchester's "Army" School
page.content: Colchester has a large garrison, and a section of the town area is taken by the barracks. There can be several regimental changes in a year, and educating the army children could cause problems. The children who do not go to an army boarding school are educated, while in Colchester, at The Alderman Blaxill School. The school has slightly less than fifty percent army children, the rest being from civilian families. Children coming over from Germany, where their fathers were part of the "Rhine Army" often find things different in England. At one time, however, children used to arrive regularly from Hong Kong, or Belize; places which are much further and more different still.
